author: rhomber98
content: If I wanted to build a messaging or twitter like app as a dapp is there a resource/channel/youtube e.t.c. you could recommend for me? I'm a senior software dev but new to dapps...  in "my world" i would use something like web-sockets and a database e.t.c... but am kind of green to this .. any advice? ðŸ™‚ ðŸ™‚

author: rhomber98
content: also would every "post" require gas?

author: frenzoid
content: Yes, any function call requires a transaction, yet method calls are free since you just read data, this is due that functions usually have a computational charge, and gas is (one of the reasons) for people to not abuse it and create infinite loops etc.. since those resources are limited

author: rhomber98
content: understandable.. but a post would presumably cost $20-200 at the moment because of NFT's?

author: frenzoid
content: as a post, you mean like, posting a text post to your dapp? same as a twitter post?

author: rhomber98
content: as an example, sure.. lets just say some text .. < 500 words

author: frenzoid
content: nah, gas depends on 2 things, the current gas price which you can check atm, and also the computational cost of the function you call

author: frenzoid
content: the price of gas based on supply and demand for the computational power of the network needed to process smart contracts and other transactions, so it varies, but usually its low, atleast for now, each year it increases, but with ETH2 it should go smoother soon

author: rhomber98
content: i want to make like something that overlays (any) website.. where you can comment freely, to bypass censorship..  It's probably not a new idea, I just think we need it..  but yeah, if it costs money its going to be hard to get much momentum.. but also.. making such a thing a dapp makes it safer

author: frenzoid
content: its not that expensive, it does cost money thats for sure, but gas usually is 1 or 2 cents, and depending on how many opcodes you run on your contract, it increases

author: frenzoid
content: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1n6mRqkBz3iWcOlRem_mO09GtSKEKrAsfO7Frgx18pNU/edit#gid=0

author: frenzoid
content: for example

author: frenzoid
content: ADD op code is 3 gas

author: frenzoid
content: so if you have a function that sums 2 numbers, it will be the current gas price * opcode gas used

author: frenzoid
content: if gas price atm is 1cent for example, summing 2 numbers would be 1 * 3 cents

author: rhomber98
content: interesting.. and for like posts for example.. if i used the website URL (hashed) as a key..  i could load some paginated data from that? (for free?)

author: frenzoid
content: oh no no, the gas is only related to the contract, since theres where you'll be doing the storing and computing, think of the smart contract as a backend and database in one, then you can connect your website to the contract using libraries such as web3 or ethers, and call functions to your contract from your website

content: I've learned watching yt videos like these https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a0osIaAOFSE but also doing challenges with scaffold-eth, those are very guided and teach you everything

content: cool, i'll check it out

author: eugeen001
content: how is that related? ETH2 is transition from current  PoW(Proof of Work) to the PoS(Proof of Stake).

author: frenzoid
content: Yep, but since miners wont need a powerful node to mine, there will be more miners, this should make gas cheaper since its easier to mine a block, or perhaps _expensiver_ since there will be more miners to incentive

author: frenzoid
content: disclaimer: im still a noob, i've learned solidity 4 months ago :p

author: rhomber98
content: It's kinda annoying.. cuz.. I have dozens of industrial grade servers that I'd be running ETH nodes on if I could.. but I can't afford 10E per node

author: rhomber98
content: like, each server is worth about the same as 1ETH lol and the returns wouldn't be enough

author: treyzania
content: running a bunch of nodes on servers owned by the same entities only marginally improves network health and decentralization compared to just one node, bandwidth bottlenecks aside

author: jree3577
content: im learning how PoW works, it seems that when doing PoW there are 2 variables that are changing the nonce, and the current blocks merkle root (as new transactions come in the root hash changes?) .. is this correct?

author: treyzania
content: the whole header contributes to the PoW hashes
